intro: Pavetta lasiopeplus, commonly known as the rough pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, with white or pale pink petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, black seeds.
